Daredev5, it plays well in the VLC player on my computer. I tested it in all players before uploading, as I always do. Have your client (Vuze or utorrent) force re-check the torrent, in case one or two of your pieces are corrupted. Or use any other player, like WMP, Media Player Classic, Total Video Player, or DivX player.
The VLC player has a problem with idx/sub files when they contain only one language, as in this case, see the enclosed Notes.
